alert.note: Alert for Sullivan; Unicoi; Washington (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 2:16AM CDT until August 16 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Carter, Cocke, Greene, Hamblen, Hawkins, Jefferson, Sullivan, Unicoi and Washington. * WHEN...Until 615 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 316 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johnson City, Morristown, Greeneville, Elizabethton, Jefferson City, Erwin, Dandridge, Jonesborough, Tusculum, White Pine, Baneberry, Parrottsville, Russellville, Midway, Gray, Banner Hill, Oak Grove, Pine Crest, Central and Hampton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
